get.description: Fetch all configuration definitions for CRM associations, which include details about how different CRM object types are associated with each other.

get.summary: Retrieve configuration details for associations between two object types.
get.description: Retrieve the configuration details for associations between two specified CRM object types.

post.summary: Batch create association definitions between two object types.
post.description: Create multiple association definitions between two specified CRM object types in a single request.

post.summary: Remove multiple association configurations between two specified object types in a batch operation.
post.description: This endpoint allows for the removal of multiple association configurations between two specified CRM object types in a single batch operation. It is useful for cleaning up or reorganizing associations between objects.

post.summary: Batch update association configurations between two object types.
post.description: Update multiple association configurations between two specified CRM object types in a single batch operation.

get.summary: Retrieve labels for associations between two object types.
get.description: Retrieve all labels that describe the relationships between two specified CRM object types. These labels provide context about the nature of the associations.

put.summary: Update an existing label for associations between two object types.
put.description: Update an existing label that describes the relationship between two specified CRM object types. This allows for modifications to existing association labels to better reflect the nature of the relationship.

post.summary: Create a new label for associations between two object types.
post.description: Create a new label that describes the relationship between two specified CRM object types. This can help in categorizing and managing associations more effectively.

delete.summary: Delete a label for an association between two object types.
delete.description: Remove a specific label from the association between two CRM object types.

category.description: The main category of the error.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

category.description: Association category. Can be HUBSPOT_DEFINED, USER_DEFINED, INTEGRATOR_DEFINED or WORK

label.description: An optional descriptor that provides additional context about the relationship between associated records, such as "Mentor" and "Mentee".

typeId.description: An integer value used to uniquely identify a specific association type within its Association Category.

AssociationSpecWithLabel.description: Defines the type, direction, and details of the relationship between two CRM objects.

scopes.crm.objects.companies.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on company records
scopes.crm.objects.companies.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on company records
scopes.crm.objects.contacts.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on contact records
scopes.crm.objects.contacts.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on contact records
scopes.crm.objects.deals.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on deal records
scopes.crm.objects.deals.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on deal records
